title: 106_s2705
content: The Act is titled the "Presidential Transition Act of 2000" and includes amendments to the Presidential Transition Act of 1963. The Presidential Transition Act of 1963 is amended to include provisions for payment of expenses during the transition for briefings and workshops to prepare key prospective Presidential appointees for governance after inauguration. Activities under this paragraph may include training in records management, human resources management, and performance-based management for key prospective Presidential appointees to comply with relevant laws and regulations. The Administrator develops a transition directory with information on department heads and agencies for key Presidential appointees. Consultation with candidates for President or Vice President is allowed to develop a systems architecture plan. The President is required to develop a systems architecture plan for computer and communications systems to coordinate a transition to Federal systems if elected. Consultations will be conducted at the discretion of the Administrator. SEC. 3. REPORT ON IMPROVING THE FINANCIAL DISCLOSURE PROCESS FOR PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEES. The Office of Government Ethics will conduct a study and submit a report on improving the financial disclosure process for Presidential nominees to Congress. The report will include recommendations on streamlining and standardizing the disclosure process. The Office of Government Ethics will make recommendations to improve the financial disclosure process for Presidential nominees, aiming to reduce filing burden and avoid duplication of effort. The recommendations will not weaken conflict of interest requirements. Authorization of appropriations is provided for the implementation of these recommendations.
